author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Chairman and MD of Quatrro Global Services Private Limited, Raman Roy, inaugurating the Centre for Innovation and Product Development at the Knowledge Institute of Technology, Salem.

A new Centre for Innovation and Product Development (CIPD) was inaugurated at the Knowledge Institute of Technology here recently.

Raman Roy, Chairman and Managing Director, Quatrro Global Services Private Limited, and a pioneer in developing business process outsourcing (BPO) and knowledge process outsourcing (KPO) in the rural parts of the country, inaugurated the new centre.

Speaking on the occasion, Mr. Raman Roy said that this initiative will be more focussed towards Prime Minister’s ‘Make in India’ theme and can create up to 10 lakh job opportunities for the rural graduates in few years.

He called upon the student community not to shun away from taking risks to become entrepreneurs.

He also commended the efforts taken by Scope e-Knowledge Centre functioning in the Knowledge Institute of Technology campus as a trial model for rural KPO.

P. S. S. Srinivasan, founder and Principal, Knowledge Institute of Technology, presided.
title: Centre for innovation inaugurated
